text: Charles Francis "Chuck" Feeney (April 23, 1931 â€“ October 9, 2023) was an Irish-American businessman and philanthropist. He was the founder of The Atlantic Philanthropies, one of the largest private foundations in the world. Feeney made his fortune as a co-founder of the Duty Free Shoppers Group, which pioneered the idea of duty-free shopping. Feeney gave away his fortune in secret for many years, until a business dispute resulted in his identity being revealed in 1997. Over the course of his life, Feeney gave away more than $8 billion. Feeney was known for his frugality, living in a rented apartment, not owning a car or a house, and flying economy-class.Taoiseach launches Chuck Feeney Biography at Trinity College Dublin Feeney died in San Francisco on October 9, 2023, at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * Interview with Feeney from the Atlantic Philanthropies Web site * A Short Biography Of Chuck Feeney Category:1931 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American billionaires Category:American philanthropists Category:Businesspeople from New Jersey
